author: greensymbiote
body:
Because those are the primary fintechs in the same space. Some of which have slower growth, smaller margins or no profit at all while still commanding higher multiples. Unlike most fintechs Paysafe has a big exposure in live sporting events and brick and mortar retail which was completely shut down in 2020 due to Covid.  In a call with analysts they discussed their decision to keep revenue growth projections in line with the fintech market at large which is 11%.  They are deliberately leaving their M&A plans out of their projections as well as their expected growth in US igaming.  

This is in keeping with Chairman of the Board Bill Foley's style which has been described as under promise and over deliver.  Many are betting on the growth of this company based on Foley's proven track record.  In just the last five years, Foley and his team grew Ceridian 3.3X ($4.2B to $14B), Dun & Bradstreet 5.6X ($2B to $11.3B) and Black Knight 8.7X ($1.6B to $14B). He also grew Fidelity National Information Services 36.4X ($2.5Billion to over $91Billion). Foley recently said, “Those characteristics of FIS are right in line with what we plan on doing with Paysafe.”
